resources.string: | Interval is not enabled for radio. Do Nothing
: is not managed or is OFF. Do nothing.
Really reset all User preferences? This will reset the application.
All Services have been stopped and all preferences have been cleared. Exit Power Manager

The permissions required by Power Manager are requested to allow the application to control certain physical radios on the device. For example, Power Manager needs to be able to access and control the Wifi and Network permissions to access and change the state of Wifi and Mobile Data. It requires access as well to Bluetooth and Sync permissions for similar reasons. It also can request the launch on startup permission to allow users to start the application with the device if they so desire.

Power Manager is developed in the Open on GitHub. If you know a few things about Android programming and are wanting to help out with development you can do so by creating issue tickets to squash bugs, and propose feature requests for future inclusion.

Power Triggers are user defined commands which are set to run at a specified battery percent. Power Triggers will run instantly whether the screen is on or off, and will instantly affect the state of the device. Power Triggers can range from doing a large number of operations, to doing effectively nothing and simply notifying the user about a certain battery level.

Power Plans are predefined settings which control how Power Manager attempts to handle device radios and interfaces. The Power Plan controls how aggresively Power Manager will look to turn off functions of the device to save power, ranging from extremely lax to hyper aggressive instant response. The standard plan is geared towards fitting most user needs.

"Power Manager is designed as a 'set it and forget it' type of application. You can toggle the settings and tweak them to your personal needs once, and then close the application and rest easy knowing that Power Manager will only ever do what you tell it to "

Power Manager is a free, open source application which seeks to save power on Android devices by turning off functions like Wifi and Bluetooth when the device\'s screen is off and not being actively used. It reaches this goal through the use of standard Android functions and permissions
Delay between when the screen turns off and when Power Manager turns off %s
Length of time elapsed before Power Manager turns %s back on
Length of time that %s will stay enabled before being turned off once again. This duration will cycle.
The Interval controls whether %s will be turned back on after it has been managed. Has no effect if %s is not managed
If %s is managed, Power Manager will automatically turn it off after the delay requested. If %s is not managed, all options on this page will be ignored
Reset all application settings to defaults. This will also close the application and is not reversible.
